today_in_history_posts.title: Building Blocks of the State Machine Approach to Consensus
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The article explains the state-machine approach to smart contract systems, building on Bitcoin's design.
- It outlines methods like cryptographic Single-Use Seals for consensus and various proofs to ensure transaction validity.
- Techniques like pruning and probabilistic validation optimize data management and fraud detection in the system.

today_in_history_posts.title: [BOLT RFC#1] Encryption spec
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A developer questions multiple aspects of implementing encryption for Amiko Pay.
- Concerns include privacy, differentiation from random data, and protection against MITM attacks.
- Queries cover public keys usage, message integrity, and the authenticate message's ack field.

today_in_history_posts.title: Estimating Likelihood for Lightning Payments to be (in)feasible
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rene Pickhardt is developing a theory on understanding payment networks, like the Lightning Network.
- His research highlights flaws in traditional liquidity models and proposes new methods for estimating payment success.
- The work emphasizes the impact of wealth distribution on payment success rates within the Lightning Network.
